name: Castle Coole Beech Trail, Castle Coole

ai.summary: A 6.5 km moderate circular trail around Castle Coole, following shaded beech woodland paths. The route is suitable for most walkers, with gentle undulations and well-maintained surfaces, making it a good half-day outing at Castle Coole Park in the UK.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained gravel and dirt paths through beech woodland. Expect some roots and gentle climbs, with muddy sections after rain. Elevation changes are mild, with occasional short ascents and descents.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and dress for the weather. Stay on marked paths, watch for roots and wet sections, and be mindful of other hikers and cyclists on shared routes. Check the weather beforehand; bring water and a small first-aid kit. Dogs should be on a leash where required, and respect property regulations around Castle Coole.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing and a waterproof layer
Light backpack, map or offline map on phone
Hat and sun protection in sunny weather
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (roughly March to October) when the weather is more predictable and the paths are drier; winter visits can be muddy and less comfortable.

seo.title: Castle Coole Beech Trail – 6.5 km Moderate Hike in Castle Coole Park, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Castle Coole Beech Trail, a 6.5 km moderate hike through beech woodland around Castle Coole Park in the UK. Ideal for a half-day outdoor escape.
